page.title: 07MATHON CHURCH.
page.content: The church at Mathon was first built by monks from Evesham abbey who while building it errected a preaching cross the base of which still stands outside the main door. In the church yard stands a large yew tree some 22 feet in girth which was planted as a sapling 900 years ago by the monks as a symbol of imortality A flat stone in front of the church was probably the hiring stone.On quarter days a farmer put a bag of money on the stone and the worker picked it up and had to serve the farmer for 3 months. When the first Domesday Book was made there was no tower at Mathon church.There was a Norman font at Mathon church but it is no longer there.
